data.title: Team
data.meta_description: Trivest is comprised of talented, experienced professionals across investment, business development, portfolio support and firm growth.
data.text:
Brian is a Partner in the firm’s buyout funds with a particular emphasis on the Trivest Discovery Fund. He joined Trivest in 2013 and is involved in all aspects of the firm, including the origination of investment opportunities, completing acquisitions, portfolio oversight and firm management. Brian is a member of Trivest’s Investment Committee and has served on the Board of several Trivest portfolio companies including Artifex, Canopy Services, Columbus Recycling, IDMWORKS, Lubrication Engineers, Novatech, OnePath Systems, Pelican Water Systems and Pet Resort Hospitality Group. Prior to joining Trivest, he was an executive at Pensam Capital and The Federated Companies where he completed numerous private equity transactions. Brian also previously worked at Lehman Brothers in investment banking and at General Electric as a member of the Corporate Staff on strategic initiatives across its financial services, plastics, medical systems, energy and aerospace business units. When he is not working alongside founders and their families, Brian can often be found spearfishing in the Bahamas with family and friends or passing a rugby ball. He received his B.S. in Computer Science and Finance from Boston College and M.B.A. from Harvard Business School.

Mary Jane joined Trivest in 2019. Her background includes nearly two decades of experience helping families navigate the complexities and opportunities of significant wealth. Mary Jane came from SunTrust Private Wealth, where she served as Vice President and Client Advisor in Miami. In this capacity, she delivered customized solutions and provided strategic advice to ultra-high net worth families. Prior to joining Trivest, she spent over 10 years with Citigroup and HSBC where she held various roles in the Private Wealth and Corporate divisions in both Miami and New York. She also spent several years working at entrepreneurial companies in the travel and manufacturing industries. She holds a B.S. from Nova Southeastern University and an M.B.A. in International Business from the University of Miami.

Dave joined Trivest in 2002. As the Firm’s General Counsel and Chief Compliance Officer, he provides transactional services and comprehensive legal oversight to the portfolio companies and assists in the transaction processes at Trivest. He is a member of Trivest’s Investment Committee and has served as a Chairman or Board Member of numerous Trivest companies including GAL Power Systems and Pelican Water Systems. Prior to joining Trivest, Dave was in-house M&A Counsel at Automatic Data Processing, Inc. (ADP) and practiced law in the New York office of Morgan Lewis, where he focused on representing private equity firms. He earned his B.A., cum laude, from Union College, his J.D. from New York University School of Law and is a member of the bar in New York and Florida.

Dave served as Global Chairman of the Association for Corporate Growth (ACG) in 2022-2023.

Allison joined Trivest in 2023. She is responsible for spearheading a diverse range of ESG and DEI initiatives. Based in Southern California, Allison combines her passion for sustainability and inclusivity to shape our ESG strategy, with a focus on delivering value to all stakeholders. Her leadership extends to managing our data collection and disclosure efforts, which serve as the foundation for her collaboration with our portfolio companies. Her work aims to implement ESG programs that enhance our portfolios’ ESG performance, reinforcing our commitment to responsible investing practices. Allison holds a B.A. with double majors in Environmental Studies & Anthropology, with a minor in Native American & Indigenous Studies, as well as a Master’s in Environmental Science and Management with specializations in Corporate Environmental Management and Energy & Climate, both from the University of California, Santa Barbara. Allison finds balance in outdoor pursuits like surfing and rock climbing and leisurely moments at home, where she enjoys cooking and gardening.

Jorge leads the Trivest Recognition Fund. He joined Trivest in 2006 and is involved in all aspects of the firm, including the origination of investment opportunities, completing acquisitions, portfolio oversight and firm management. He is a member of Trivest’s Investment Committee and serves as Chairman or Board Member of numerous Trivest portfolio companies including Perricone Juices, ASA Safety Supply, BCC Engineering, Total PowerGen Solutions, Office Pride and NuEnergen. Prior to joining Trivest, Jorge spent three years at Credit Suisse First Boston where he evaluated and executed long-term, value-oriented investments in publicly traded companies for private clients. He received his B.A. in Economics from Columbia University and M.B.A., with honors, from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.

Jorge was born and raised in Miami, where he currently lives with his wife and two kids, and you can usually find him on the mountain bike trails or road cycling on weekends.

Todd joined Trivest in 2008, and in 2022 he was promoted from Chief Operating Officer to Partner, Operations. Todd leads numerous activities including the management of Trivest’s investor relations/fundraising activities, accounting and finance departments, robust deal marketing programs and annual initiatives including Trivest’s Investor and CEO Conferences. In addition, he is responsible for identifying strategic acquisition targets, evaluating investment opportunities, deal execution and portfolio company management. Todd currently serves on the Board of Directors of NuEnergen and works closely with IDMWORKS. Prior to joining Trivest, he was a member of the healthcare investment banking groups of Lehman Brothers and LEERINK Partners in New York. Outside of Trivest, he serves on the Boards of Junior Achievement of Greater Miami and the Center for Jewish Life at Beth David in Miami. He received his B.A. in Economics, Phi Beta Kappa, from Indiana University and M.B.A. from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.

Yan joined Trivest in 2022. He is responsible for the analysis of investment opportunities, identification of strategic acquisition targets and monitoring of existing portfolio companies. Prior to joining Trivest, Yan was a Vice President at CIP Capital, a New York based private equity firm where he focused on middle-market investments in the business services sector over his 6-year tenure. Prior to CIP Capital, Yan was an Associate at Lovell Minnick Partners, a Philadelphia based private equity firm focused on financial and business services sectors. Yan began his career at Barclays as an investment banking Analyst in the Financial Institutions Group. Yan received his B.B.A. in Finance from the George Washington University, and was a former Australian professional tennis player, being ranked on the men’s ATP circuit and playing in the Australian Open Juniors.

Amir is a Partner in the firm’s growth/non-control investment strategies (TGIF). He joined Trivest in 2014 and is involved in the origination of investment opportunities, completing transactions, portfolio oversight and fund management. He is a member of Trivest’s Investment Committee and has served as a Board Member of numerous current and historical Trivest companies including Big Truck Rental, Creative Service Partners, EPIKA Fleet Services, Family First Homecare, Jon-Don, TCDI and Turnpoint Services, among others. Prior to Trivest, Amir was with Sun Capital Partners where he spent nearly five years screening and executing middle market transactions across a wide range of industries. Amir began his career at Brown Gibbons Lang & Co., where he focused on mergers & acquisitions, refinancings and restructuring transactions. Amir received a B.S. in Industrial Engineering and Management Sciences from Northwestern University and is a CFA Charterholder.

Tarek joined Trivest in 2022. He is responsible for the analysis of investment opportunities, identification of strategic acquisition targets, and monitoring of existing portfolio companies. Prior to joining Trivest, he was a Private Equity Principal for Tygon Peak Capital, where he spent 3.5 years spearheading the evaluation, diligence and execution of control buyout deals in the lower middle market, as well as actively partnering with management teams of portfolio companies to drive the value creation plans. Prior to that, Tarek was on the private equity deal teams at Silver Swan Capital, Macquarie Capital, and Goldman Sachs’ Special Situations Group. He received his B.Sc. in Economics from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, and his M.B.A. from Columbia Business School, where he was a member of the Value Investing Program.

Since joining Trivest in 2020, Stephanie has built relationships and sourced investment opportunities for Trivest in Canada. Her role has now expanded to business development across North America for Trivest’s newest and largest fund, the $1.3 billion Trivest Recognition Fund. Prior to Trivest, Stephanie was a Director with the Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce (CIBC) responsible for originating and managing lending relationships with privately held middle market companies while leading a team of account managers. Stephanie holds an Honours Bachelor of Commerce Degree from McMaster University. She is a member of the Association for Corporate Growth (ACG) Toronto Chapter’s Deal Source Committee and actively participates in Opus Connect, Exponent Women, and various other networking groups. She is involved with a number of charitable organizations including Gilda’s Club Greater Toronto where she’s been a Board Member since 2019. Outside of work Stephanie enjoys spending time at the cottage, sinking birdie putts, cheering for her favourite hockey teams and has yet to meet a dog she didn’t love.

Ryan joined Trivest in 2019 as its first-ever marketing hire. He leads the integration of systems and processes to modernize firm communications, elevate the design aesthetic, and improve overall marketing efficiency at the firm level and across our portfolio. Ryan has extensive experience leading creative production and brand development initiatives within the real estate, technology and sports industries. Prior to joining Trivest, Ryan held multiple roles in brand marketing, including Group Creative Director of CAA’s golf division, a leading sponsorship consulting agency with clients including Bose, CDW, Farmers Insurance, Zurich and the PGA Tour. He holds a BA summa cum laude in Economic Geography and an MS in Real Estate, both from the University of Florida.

Ryan lives in South Miami with his family, and he can often be found holding a golf club or a camera.

Troy joined Trivest in 1989 and as managing partner leads resource allocation, portfolio oversight, limited partner relations and overall firm administration. Over his tenure at Trivest, he has led the origination, structuring and financing of more than 50 acquisitions and exits. In addition, Troy created many of Trivest’s key differentiators and plays an active role in the firm’s unique marketing programs. He is a member of Trivest’s Investment Committee and has served as Chairman or Board Member of numerous Trivest companies including Columbus Recycling, National Auto Care, Northfield Industries and Pelican Water Systems. Outside the firm, he is on the board of Junior Achievement Miami and enjoys spending time on the water with his family. Prior to joining Trivest, Troy spent six years serving in various capacities with Southeast Bank, N.A. in Miami. He received his B.B.A., magna cum laude, and M.B.A. from Stetson University.

Dan advises the firm on business development opportunities in the Western United States, with a strong focus on California businesses. Dan spent the first portion of his career as an operating executive for consumer products businesses. He held the position of Chief Executive Officer of five retail businesses, including Macy’s California and Macy’s West. Later in his career, he was a Partner at an investment banking firm, where he worked on buy and sell-side deals in a variety of industries. He earned his Bachelor of Science degree from Claremont McKenna College. He and his wife live in Marin County, outside of San Francisco. They enjoy spending time with their four children and seven grandchildren.

Tim advises on and supports the firm’s business development efforts throughout the Southeast. Prior to working with Trivest, he led business development at one of the fastest-growing construction companies in the Southeast for 18 years. Tim started his career in the public sector as a campaign manager for numerous statewide cabinet races, as well as an advisor to two Florida cabinet members on policy issues for state agencies overseen by the Governor and Cabinet. He received his B.S. from the University of Florida and lives in Tallahassee, FL, with his wife, two sons and daughter. Tim is an avid rucker, participating in endurance events lasting six to 24 hours, and has served on the Board for the Florida Sheriffs Youth Ranches since 2006.

Dwight founded his first start-up, PPR Talent Management Group (Travel Nursing), in 1996 with a $10,000 investment. Under his leadership, PPR grew organically to over $100,000,000 in annual revenue before selling a majority interest to Trivest Partners in 2016. Currently Dwight is the CEO of Hueman People Solutions. Hueman’s innovative approach to talent acquisition enables private equity backed portfolio companies achieve best-in-class hiring results.

Dwight’s people first approach to value creation has been recognized nationally by Gallop and the Great Place to Work Institute (GPTWI). Dwight’s companies have been nationally recognized by the GPTWI 16 times and in 2013 PPR was recognized as the nation’s best small or medium size business to work for in America. Furthermore, Gallup has recognized Hueman and PPR as one of the 39 most engaged workforces in the world four times.

Dwight currently serves as an active board member for Trivest backed portfolio companies. His board service has, or currently includes, PPR Talent Management Group, Turnpoint Services, Novatech, Family First Homecare, and Growth Orthopedics.

Amy Kothari is a seasoned executive with extensive experience in management, operations, M&A, and board leadership. She has a proven track record of driving growth and expanding businesses. Today, Amy is the Executive Chairman of INTACT Property Restoration backed by West Edge Partners, a board member and advisor of a residential services business backed by Trivest Partners, and board member and advisor of a retail clothing business backed by Bertram Capital. In addition to Amy’s board service, she is a founding partner of PhillySafe, a non-profit organization with a mission to reduce crime in the highest crime areas using the latest epidemiology and criminology research.

In 2002, Amy joined My Alarm Center (MAC) as CFO, and in 2004 she was appointed CEO and board member. Under her leadership, the company experienced significant growth, expanding from a “start-up” with less than $4 million in revenue to over $200 million. Amy successfully guided MAC through 19 years of acquisitions and technology enabled organic growth. Over the years, she built a highly seasoned long tenured management team reflecting investments in the development of human capital and creation of a culture based on high levels of trust, commitment, transparency, and accountability.

Amy streamlined growth and operations, including the development of a scalable technology platform supporting marketing, sales, service, and growth. Her strategic vision and strong operating skills positioned MAC to scale and optimize its growth platform, enabling the company to navigate complex and creative capital market solutions and respond effectively to shifts in the economic and competitive landscape. Her actions culminated in a late 2021 merger to create one of the largest full-service residential and commercial security companies in the U.S. serving approximately 350,000 customers. Amy stepped down as CEO following the merger and remains a member of the MAC board today.

Before joining MAC, Amy served as Executive Director at CIBC World Markets where she led debt transactions in media/telecom related industries. She also held finance positions at Comcast and Cox.

Amy received her B.A. in Business and Art History from Franklin and Marshall College and an MBA in Finance from American University. She is a member of the Kogod Advisory Council at American University and was recently appointed to the American University Board of Trustees.

Through Kristi’s roles in various industries, she has developed a broad spectrum of capabilities including successful departmental leadership, marketing and operations. Her skills include effective hands-on implementation in portfolio companies as well as advisement in outside company consulting roles. Her positions included president of 1-800-DryClean, one of the fastest growing dry-cleaning franchise brands in the county, president of Molly Maid, the second largest maid service franchises in the country which experienced the highest dollar growth under her leadership, chief marketing officer at AM Conservation Group, the largest energy efficiency company serving utilities in the country, and chief operating officer for one of the largest multi-unit operators in the number one brand for the massage industry, Massage Envy. Kristi is a University of Michigan graduate.

Todd Recknagel served as CEO or Operating Partner in a variety of companies including: CEO of the largest franchisor in the handyman category, Mr. Handyman International; CEO of the largest energy efficiency products supplier in the country, AM Conservation Group; Board Member & Partner in Take 5 Oil Change; and Board Member & Operating Partner and in the largest multi-unit Franchisee group of the leading brand in the massage category, Massage Envy, with over 90 units. He is also Board Member & Operating Partner in Quatrro Business Support Services and Office Pride franchising with over 145 units. Todd received his MBA in finance at the Eli Broad School at MSU. He has partnered or invested in over 75 transactions with over $350 million in gains for private equity investors.

Tim has over 25 years of experience in M&A transaction origination/execution/financing and principal investing across a wide range of industries. Prior to joining Hall Capital, Tim was Managing Director for over nine years at Gridiron Capital, a middle-market private equity firm. Throughout his career in investment banking with Morgan Stanley, Bankers Trust and UBS in New York and London, Tim executed advisory and financing transactions totaling over $15 billion. At Trivest, he serves as an active board member of ASB Sports.

Tim played professional baseball in the Cincinnati Reds organization. He graduated from the University of Missouri with a B.A. in economics and played varsity football and baseball. He received his M.A. from Washington University in St. Louis and is a graduate of the Advanced Management Program at the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.
